reviews.text: Only here for one night but really enjoyed our stay. The single room was a bit poky but the double also had a sitting room, unexpectedly. Looking over the courtyard, as requested, very quiet apart from inconsiderate guests coming in noisily at 2 am. Breakfast excellent and plenty of choice. In the best position in town and I guess it's 2 stars because there is no lift.

reviews.text: This is a great hotel for a short break in central Palma and an elegant place to stay with a lovely central courtyard and rooms overlooking. Not however for the physically challenged as there is no lift to any of the 4 floors. Good breakfast room for an extended continental breakfast all included in the en-suite room price. My wife and I and two friends stayed in Easter Week and had a grand stand position for the Parades. The location has to be key as it was 10 minutes walk to the Soller train station, directly on Jaime III, the main shopping street, 10 minutes from Palma Cathedral, 5 minutes from superb Tapas Bars, and one minute from the nearest bus tour stop for Palma. We will return.

reviews.text: We have just returned from a very pleasant visit to the hotel Born in Palma. We stayed for four nights and could not fault the hotel other than the paper-thin bedroom walls! I was kept awake the first night by the snoring in the next bedroom - you could hear everything! For this reason, we would not choose this hotel again. However, if this would not be a problem, everything else is good especially the ambiance. The entrance hall and the position of the hotel are particularly appealing.

reviews.title: What a great three star hotel
reviews.text: A good place to stay if you want a three star central hotel is the Hotel Born, c/Sant Jaume 3. Its a friendly 16th century hotel with a central courtyard, where you can have breakfast or evening drinks under palm trees. The rooms cost about £60 per night and there can be trouble getting in sometimes because the place is so popular. The best way to book is via the internet. Type in --- and it should come up. The photos on the site show how nice it is inside. The rooms are a little plain, but clean and comfortable. It is situated about one hundred yads from the top of the Passaig des born, which is as central as you want. You are five minutes walk from the sea and cathedral and you do not get the noise that you will find by the seafront.
